item.title: 爱达荷州的立法者预计将就一项法案进行投票，该法案将禁止使用任何公共资金进行性别确认护理，包括使用工作医疗保险的州雇员和医疗补助计划（Medicaid）覆盖的成年人。
item.description:
Idaho lawmakers are expected to vote on a bill that would ban the use of any public funds for gender-affirming care, including for state employees using work health insurance and for adults covered by Medicaid. https://t.co/WFaPpu9AA8

— ABC News (@ABC) March 18, 2024

item.title: 在气候变化、人口增长和耐药性的推动下，真菌感染的危险性正在不断增加，美国疾病预防控制中心和世界卫生组织发出的新警告更是强化了这一点。

item.title: 在参议员舒默呼吁在以色列举行新的选举之后，白宫的约翰-柯比告诉 @MarthaRaddatz 说，"如果要举行新的选举，这将由他们选出的以色列政府来决定是否以及如何举行新的选举"。
item.description:
After Sen. Schumer calls for new elections in Israel, White House’s John Kirby tells @MarthaRaddatz that it’s “up to the Israeli government that they elect to determine whether and how, if there's going to be new elections, what that would look like.” https://t.co/zsfFxOoTxb pic.twitter.com/ID5kboq8ax

— ABC News (@ABC) March 18, 2024

item.title: 将标准工作周从 40 小时减少到 32 小时的提案本周取得了突破性进展，在参议院站稳了脚跟，该提案要求企业提供 32 小时工作周，但保留员工工资：
item.description:
A push to slash the standard workweek from 40 hours to 32 achieved a breakthrough this week, gaining a foothold in the Senate with a proposal that would require businesses to offer the 32-hour workweek but preserve employee pay.

Read more: https://t.co/SaAYfqn9fC pic.twitter.com/KvaAcsxcDL

— ABC News (@ABC) March 18, 2024

item.title: 美国联邦调查局（FBI）称，在马萨诸塞州的一个家庭从已故父亲的私人物品中发现了 22 件在二战冲绳战役后被掠夺的历史文物后，这些文物已被归还日本。
item.description:
Twenty-two historic artifacts that were looted following the Battle of Okinawa in World War II have been returned to Japan after a family from Massachusetts discovered them in their late father’s personal items, the FBI said. https://t.co/VBHWBFIZdx

item.title: 16 名女运动员对 NCAA 的跨性别参赛政策提起诉讼，运动员们声称该政策侵犯了她们根据第九章（Title IX）享有的权利，第九章是禁止在接受联邦资助的机构中实行性别歧视的法律。
item.description:
Sixteen female athletes have filed suit against the NCAA over its transgender participation policy, which the athletes claim violates their rights under Title IX, the law that prohibits discrimination based on sex at institutions receiving federal funding. https://t.co/TfzyarWoIU pic.twitter.com/0X8cLWx96n

— ABC News (@ABC) March 18, 2024

item.title: "很多人都说，'那天你是个英雄'。那天我只是想保护一个小男孩。"在密尔沃基一条繁忙的街道上，一名公交车司机救助了一名独自徘徊的小男孩，在警察将他与家人团聚之前，将他带到车上取暖。
item.description:
"A lot of people saying, ‘You were a hero that day.’ I just looked to protect a little boy that day."

A bus driver came to the rescue of a young boy wandering alone on a busy Milwaukee street, bringing him on board to keep him warm before police reunited him with his family. pic.twitter.com/tv8e5MmzaL

— ABC News (@ABC) March 18, 2024

item.title: 众议员罗-卡纳（Ro Khanna）告诉 @玛莎-拉达茨，众议院通过的 TikTok 法案实际上并不能保护美国人，相反，他正在推动其他立法，以更好地防止外国对手获取私人信息。
item.description:
Rep. Ro Khanna tells @MarthaRaddatz that the TikTok bill the House passed wouldn't actually protect Americans, instead pushing for other legislation that he says would better prevent foreign adversaries from obtaining private information. https://t.co/rMOkppRW39 pic.twitter.com/XVsEBYunDc

— ABC News (@ABC) March 17, 2024

item.title: "Taylor Swift | The Eras Tour (Taylor's Version) "已正式登陆 Disney+。这部斯威夫特大热演唱会电影的流媒体版本包含四首原声歌曲，这四首歌在之前的剧场版和点播版中都没有出现过。
item.description:
"Taylor Swift | The Eras Tour (Taylor's Version)" has officially arrived on Disney+.

The streaming version of Swift's mega-hit concert film contains four acoustic songs not previously featured in either the theatrical or VOD versions. https://t.co/5IFc5pMf9a
